passages.text: **Great Wall Motor**
**Raise 26/27E Sales Forecast and To HKD23.7; Buy**

GWM 2Q earnings were in line with consensus, while management reiterated their bullish guidance on GWM 2H shipment to surge by 40-50% HoH, backed by strong model cycle (Expect 2H (ICE+NEV) vol +40% HoH backed by 12 new models). We lift TP to HKD23.7 with the following upgrades and assumptions: (1) lift GWM 26/27 sales volume forecast to 1.67/1.78mn units from which export alone lifts to 715/822k units; (2)26/27E GPM forecast both stabilize at 17.5%; (3) 26/27E NP lifts to Rmb17/17.4bn. The company registered Rmb15.6bn FCF in 2Q25 (FCF conversion at 1.6x); we expect FY25-27E FCF at Rmb10/21/22bn. Key takeaways from analyst briefing are provided below.

**2Q** **results** - 2Q revenue was +8% YoY/+31% QoQ to Rmb52.3bn, driven by sales volume +10% YoY/+22% QoQ. 1H25 blended ASP remained at high level of Rmb162k,versus Rmb135/165k in 1H23/1H24. 2Q GPM was -1.8ppt YoY/+1.1ppt QoQ to 15.5%.SG&A + R&D as % of total revenue was +1.5ppt YoY/-1.4ppt QoQ to 12.0% in 2Q. NP came in at Rmb4.59bn, +19% YoY/+162% QoQ.
**Sales outlook** - Mgmt. expect 2H25E sales to book 40-50% HoH growth, and aim to return to top 3 automakers within China in the next 3-5 years, with mid-term annual sales target at 3mn units.

**New model pipeline** - Per mgmt., they have entered a strong new model cycle into 2025; new models launched YTD have received decent feedback, including High Mountain, Fierce Dragon, Big Dog and Tank 500, which should boost 2H25E sales growth. 2H25-1H26E new model pipeline: (1) High Mountain 7 starting delivery in Sep-25E, (2) Mid- to large-size SUVs based on Blue Mountain will be launched in 4Q25E and 2026E, (3) New Tank 400/700 will be launched soon, with sales volume to potentially double given decent customer feedback on new Tank 500, (4) Ora and Haval will launch 1-2 new models based on EC platform in 4Q25E.
**Valuation** - By rolling our unchanged 1lx PER to 2026E, we lift our TP from HK$18.6/Rmb17.7 to HK$23.7/Rmb21.9. Maintain Buy on H share. (Continued below...)

Source: Citi Research

Citi Research is a division of Citigroup Global Markets Inc. (the "Firm"), which does and seeks to do business with companies covered in its research reports. As a result, investors should be aware that the Firm may have a conflict of interest that could affect the objectivity of this report. Investors should consider this report as only a single factor in making their investment decision. Certain products (not inconsistent with the author's published research) are available only on Citi's portals.

Brand strategy of WEY – Per mgmt., WEY brand will enhance its product competitiveness through fast iteration of their products. They plan to launch a new platform and mid- to large- size SUVs in 4Q25E or early 2026E, which will be equipped with advanced smart feature.

Overseas sales outlook – Mgmt. target 2025E overseas sales to hit 500k units. In 1H25, sales volume of nearly all overseas markets (except Russia) registered 30- 100% YoY growth. Looking into 2030E, mgmt. target overseas sales to hit 1mn units. (1) Latin America market registered 40% YoY growth in 1H25. GWM's factory in Brazil has started production in Aug- 25, which should enhance their cost advantage going forward. (2) Europe: EC15 is to be launched in Europe at end- 2025E or early- 2026E.

Overseas profitability – For Russia market, despite margin declined by 3- 4ppt YoY, they are still profitable in 1H25. Overall, the profitability of Tank & Pickup brand in overseas is close to that in China, while the margin level of Haval in overseas is 5ppt higher than that in China.
Cost advantage in Brazil – After localized production in Brazil, mgmt. estimate their cost per car would be Rmb5- 10k lower than importing from China, according to mgmt.

Ora brand – Ora brand is to launch EC15 in 2026E, targeting mainstream BEV market, with pricing more competitive than Good Cat. Also, Good Cat, Ballet Cat and Flash Cat will launch facelift soon. Along with sales ramp- up, mgmt. expect net loss of Ora to narrow going forward.

Great Wall Motor manufactures and sells pickup trucks and sport- utility vehicles (SUVs) in China. Major SUV brands are Haval and WEY. The company also does R&D, and develops and manufactures principal automotive parts and components for use in the assembly of pickup trucks and SUVs.

We rate Great Wall- H Buy. With a positive outlook on China NEV and exports, we believe a leading auto company like GWM could benefit from sector growth and increasing NEV penetration due to its strong NEV model cycle and upcoming high- end NEV brand launches.

By applying 11x 2026E P/E, we derive our Great Wall- H target price of HK\$23.70. We adopt a lower PE multiple of 11x (versus China auto sector average valuation of 12x since 2016) to factor in overseas earnings downside risk on potential tariff and tax hike.

Downside risks that could prevent the stock from reaching our target price include: 1) strong volume growth in low- margin NEV products may further drag down overall earnings, 2) policy risks might pose negative impact risk to GWM's export sales.

Great Wall Motor manufactures and sells pickup trucks and sport- utility vehicles (SUVs) in China. Major SUV brands are Haval and WEY. The company also does R&D, and develops and manufactures principal automotive parts and components for use in the assembly of pickup trucks and SUVs.

We rate Great Wall Motor A- shares as Sell due to an unappealing risk/reward balance, as the A shares trade at an 15x 2025E PER vs. the H share at 7x. With a positive outlook on China NEV and exports, we believe a leading company like GWM will benefit from the sector growth and increasing NEV penetration rate due to its strong NEV model cycle and upcoming high- end NEV brand launch. However, owing to the stretched valuation, we think the risk/reward on GWM- A is not attractive.
By applying a 11x 2026E P/E, we derive our Great Wall- A target price of Rmb21.90. We adopt a lower PE multiple of 11x (versus China auto sector
average valuation of 12x since 2016) to factor in overseas earnings downside risk on potential tariff and tax hike.

Upside risks that could lead to the stock trading above our target price are 1) higher- than- expected margin lift on NEV product; 2) higher- than- expected export sales; and 3) greater- than- expected SUV volume.

Typically, company management is more likely to participate when the analyst has a positive view of the company.

Guide to Citi Research Fundamental Research Investment Ratings: Citi Research stock recommendations include an investment rating and an optional risk rating to highlight high risk stocks.
Risk rating takes into account both price volatility and fundamental criteria. Stocks will either have no risk rating or a High risk rating assigned.

Investment Ratings: Citi Research investment ratings are Buy, Neutral and Sell. Our ratings are a function of analyst expectations of expected total return ("ETR") and risk. ETR is the sum of the forecast price appreciation (or depreciation) plus the dividend yield for a stock within the next 12 months. The target price is based on a 12 month time horizon. The Investment rating definitions are: Buy (1) ETR of \(15\%\) or more or \(25\%\) or more for High risk stocks; and Sell (3) for negative ETR. Any covered stock not assigned a Buy or a Sell is a Neutral (2). For stocks rated Neutral (2), if an analyst believes that there are insufficient valuation drivers and/or investment catalysts to derive a positive or negative investment view, they may elect with the approval of Citi Research management not to assign a target price and, thus, not derive an ETR. Citi Research may suspend its rating and target price and assign "Rating Suspended" status for regulatory and/or internal policy reasons. Citi Research may also suspend its rating and target price and assign "Under Review" status for other exceptional circumstances (e.g. lack of information critical to the analyst's thesis, trading suspension) affecting the company and/or trading in the company's securities. In both such situations, the rating and target price will show as "—" and "—" respectively in the rating history price chart. Prior to 11 April 2022 Citi Research assigned "Under Review" status to both situations and prior to 11 Nov 2020 only in exceptional circumstances. As soon as practically possible, the analyst will publish a note re-establishing a rating and investment thesis. Investment ratings are determined by the ranges described above at the time of initiation of coverage, a change in investment and/or risk rating, or a change in target price (subject to limited management discretion). At times, the expected total returns may fall outside of these ranges because of market price movements and/or other short-term volatility or trading patterns. Such interim deviations will be permitted but will become subject to review by Research Management. Your decision to buy or sell a security should be based upon your personal investment objectives and should be made only after evaluating the stock's expected performance and risk.

Catalyst Watch and STV Upside/Downside calls: Citi Research may also include a Catalyst Watch or STV Upside or Downside call to indicate the analyst expects the share price to rise (fall) in absolute terms over a specified period of 30 or 90 days in reaction to one or more specific near- term catalysts or events impacting the company or the market. A Catalyst Watch will be published when Analyst confidence is high that an impact to share price will occur; it will be a STV when confidence level is moderate. A Catalyst Watch or STV Upside/Downside call will automatically expire at the end of the specified 30/90 day period. The Catalyst Watch will also be automatically removed if share price performance (calculated at market close) exceeds \(15\%\) against the direction of the call (unless over- ridden by the analyst). The analyst may also remove a Catalyst Watch or STV call prior to the end of the specified period in a published research note. A Catalyst Watch/STV Upside or Downside call may be different from and does not affect a stock's fundamental equity rating, which reflects a longer- term total absolute return expectation. For purposes of FINRA ratings- distribution- disclosure rules, a Catalyst Watch/STV Upside call corresponds to a buy recommendation and a Catalyst Watch/STV Downside call corresponds to a sell recommendation. Any stock not assigned to a Catalyst Watch Upside, Catalyst Watch Downside, STV Upside, or STV Downside call is considered Catalyst Watch/STV No View. For purposes of FINRA ratings distribution- disclosure rules, we correspond Catalyst Watch/STV No View to Hold in our ratings distribution table for our Catalyst Watch/STV Upside/Downside rating system. However, we reiterate that we do not consider No View to be a recommendation. For all Catalyst Watch/STV Upside/Downside calls, risk exists that the catalyst(s) and associated share- price movement will not materialize as expected.
